activities_info.details: Our students are working with the Philadelphia Poison Control Center that is functioning as a COVID hotline for Philadelphians.
We have a wellness committee, comprised of students and faculty, that create virtual wellness activities for students, including workouts, coffee houses, cooking classes, etc.

We have more than 100 volunteer activities identified for our students to participate in, ranging widely, and involving both COVID and non-COVID related activities. If you want to connect with our students regarding a specific program, please contact Dr. Christian, and she can put you in touch with the most appropriate team.

We have paired medical students with faculty to work on a variety of COVID-related research, both basic science and clinical. We also have students working on a Philadelphia COVID hotline and assisting with monitoring ICU patients in a virtual, real-time ICU. We have many activities related to COVID.
We have students organizing "One Extra Bag" a volunteer service that delivers food safely to housestaff and to housebound, vulnerable elderly patients.
We have students working on MANY different technology / IT projects with faculty supervision. Many are assisting with setting up telehealth systems for practices in our healthcare system.
